What shows and movies do you think younger kids should be aloud to watch and shouldn't be aloud to watch. And do u know any REALLY over-protective parents?

post_info.post_title: What shows do you think younger kids should(n't) be aloud to watch?

Younger children shouldn't watch really violent movies or movies with unappropriate material in them. I mean there have been tests that show from watching violence at a young age over and over they might have an effect on how they are later on in life.
POSSIBLY extreme violence, but thats it imo.
I wouldn't say POSSIBLY I would say MOST DEFINITLY.
Well it really depends on the child, quite often.
I don't know...I mean I wouldn't want my child at the age of 5 watching extreme violent things...
I would think that most television shows on MTV and Comedy Central they have a lot of sexuality nd bad words
i would treat my child as any other good parent, i would tell him right from wrong. i watched violence at an early age and i think i turned out alright. but, as said before, it depends on the child.

you are very right gilligan

gilligan, I know. I love me. ;) 
 
 Despite what avid gamers, people with obsessive TV disorder, and people who listen to idiotic music (see 95% of modern rock, rap, and pop) say, all forms of media have an effect on children. I'm not against letting kids view mildy violent movies, like Harry Potter, for example, but letting a 10 year old watch some random, tasteless horror flick is idiocy. 
 
 But of course, according to gilligan's lack of logic, kids could watch Resevoir Dogs and come out ok, but then again, this is coming from a person who believes the legal drinking age should be lowered to 14...

Most children should be allowed to watch any show with content including:
 Sex
 Violence
 Language
 Adult Themes
 .....
 
 This does not include movies with extremely violent nature. Everything else is fine as long as the parent accompanies the child watching the movie and does not allow the child to use the language he is "shown" on the movies....

 Always Stay Open Minded

it DOES depend on the person.
 My boyfriend grew up seeing anything and everything on TV and wherever, and probably turned out more decent than I did, and I didn't have a TV until, well... still don't really... I see movies every now and then. So I grew up without any television. And I mean any. I first started seeing movies in school in 3rd grade...
 
 Of course then, I got all of my violence from books.... then is reading bad? hah. No.
 
 That's not really a good arguement, I know. You think differently (if at all) when watching TV in compared to reading books...
 
 
 ANYWAYS....
 
 I think children can watch whatever they want, as long as they have a decent concept of reality. If they have NO concept of reality, NO TV (maybe that's what my parents did... -inwardly chuckles- whatever)

I think it's the sort of thing that should be handled case-by-case. Making a blanket decision on what kids should be allowed to watch (ex. making the MPAA rating system enforceable by law) is stupid because it doesn't allow the parents to exercise any judgement. There is a HUGE difference between allowing a 7 year old to watch Natural Born Killers and allowing a 14 or 15 year old to watch, say, The Matrix.
